response:
Young woman with subacute progression and multifocal CNS involvement (brainstem plus optic nerve) most strongly suggests inflammatory demyelination; vascular and structural midbrain causes remain important alternatives, and a pupil-involving third nerve palsy mandates exclusion of a posterior communicating artery aneurysm.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple sclerosis relapse (midbrain plaque with left optic neuritis)", "Paramedian midbrain infarct (Weber/Claude/Benedikt pattern)", "Midbrain cavernous malformation with recent haemorrhage", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder", "MOG-antibody\u2013associated disease", "Intrinsic brainstem glioma", "Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing third nerve palsy"]
